bookCover.coverDescription: An Interactive book on geometry for grade 2 students.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Geometry is a kind of mathematics that deals with shapes and figures. Geometry explains how to build or draw shapes, measure them, and compare them. People use geometry in many kinds of work, from building houses and bridges to planning space travel.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Points, lines, line segments and rays are some basic terms of geometry. We will study them through diagrams given below.
a) Point

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: A point has no length, no breadth and no height. For example A, B, and C in the given figure.
b) Line

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: A line is made up of many points on a straight path. AB is a straight line and XY is a curved line.
c) Line segment

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: A line segment is part of a line. It has two end points. Here MN is a line segment.
d) Ray

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: A ray has no endpoint with an arrow head in one direction. In the adjoining figures, PQ and RS are rays.
Look at the following figures and choose the correct answers.

params.text: Triangles, squares, circles etc. are flat or plane figures. Other geometric shapes are solid figures. A cube is a solid figure with flat surfaces. A square box is an example of a cube. A sphere, such as a baseball, is a solid figure with a curved surface. Cones and cylinders are other solid figures which we will learn about.
